sentences.english: Asimo can walk, climb stairs and recognize voices.
sentences.chinese: 阿西莫不僅會走路，會上樓梯，還會辨認聲音。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the butcher recognized the dog as belonging to a neighbor of his.
sentences.chinese: 很幸運地，肉商辨認出’這隻狗是屬於他鄰居的。

sentences.english: Why is the man in black the thief?
sentences.chinese: 你知道包大人是如何辨認出小偷的嗎？

sentences.english: The porters may be identified by their red caps.
sentences.chinese: 從他們戴的紅帽子就可以辨認出他們是行李搬運工。

sentences.english: As I got closer, I could make out a woman's bloody torso.
sentences.chinese: 走近後，我辨認出一個女人血淋淋的軀幹。

sentences.english: Current cameras rely on lenses to produce a recognizable image.
sentences.chinese: 目前的攝像設備依靠鏡頭來產生可辨認的圖像信號。

sentences.english: They are easy to pick out because they do not have as sharp a point as wood screws do.
sentences.chinese: 他們是容易辨認，因爲他們沒有一點爲削木螺釘。

sentences.english: By the 6th month, the subendothelial layer could be distinguished.
sentences.chinese: 內皮下層第6個月可辨認出來。

sentences.english: A driver must be able to read traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員必須能辨認交通標誌。

sentences.english: The letter on the monument was seriously worn and illegible.
sentences.chinese: 紀念碑上的字母嚴重磨損，難以辨認。

sentences.english: The identification of the criminal investigation phase is one of the most commonly used means of investigation.
sentences.chinese: 刑事偵查階段的辨認是一種最常用的偵查手段。

sentences.english: It's always a problem deciphering his handwriting.
Even detectives and psychologists can spot a liar only about 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 就連偵探和心理學家也只能辨認出47%的說謊者。

sentences.english: These are all single characters and are easy to identify.
sentences.chinese: 這些漢字都是獨體字，比較好辨認。

sentences.english: Secondly, the proposed identification system, the improvement of our country and re-build.
sentences.chinese: 然後，提出了對我國辨認制度的完善與再構建。

sentences.english: He touched the mug, recognizing it as one of the ship's set.
sentences.chinese: 博茲碰了碰杯子，辨認出它屬於船上的餐具。

definition: to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
